articles.title: Kim Jong Il Pays Unofficial Visit to Northeastern and Huadong Regions of China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Pays Unofficial Visit to Northeastern and Huadong Regions of China
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, paid an unofficial visit to the People's Republic of China from May 20 to 26 at the invitation of Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the PRC.
					 He was accompanied by Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK; Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet; Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC; Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK; Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK; Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK; and Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador e. p. to China. 
					
					 Party and state leaders of China and people warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il who visited China again nine months later carrying with him deep friendship towards the fraternal Chinese people and accorded him cordial hospitality with utmost sincerity.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited the Northeastern and Huadong regions of China.
					
					 He was kindly greeted by Dai Bingguo, state councilor, at railway station on the border who went there upon the authorization of Hu Jintao and the C.C., the CPC. 
					
					 He was also greeted by Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC; Sheng Guangzu, minister of Railways; Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC; Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, and leading officials of the party and government in Beijing and the province. He received a bunch of fragrant flowers from children.
					
					 He warmly met Dai Bingguo and had a conversation.
					
					 Dai warmly welcomed Kim Jong Il's visit to China on behalf of Hu Jintao, the C.C., the CPC and the State Council of China. 
					
					 Recalling that Hu sent him to the railway station to specially greet Kim Jong Il who attaches special importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship, Dai noted that Kim Jong Il's seventh visit to China in the beautiful season when spring scent is strongly felt and everything comes to life would mark a historical event in developing the friendly and cooperative relations between China and the DPRK on a fresh higher stage. 
					
					 Noting that he was pleased to witness again through the visit the progress made in Northeastern and Huadong regions undergoing fresh changes in the days of creating a new history of modernization, Kim Jong Il expressed thanks to the leading officials in Beijing, provinces and cities and people for their warm reception. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited Mudanjiang City, Heilongjiang Province first. 
					
					 He was greeted at Heilongjiang Railway Station by Ji Bingxuan, secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the CPC, Wang Xiankui, governor of the province, the secretary of the Mudanjiang City Committee of the CPC and other officials of the province and the city. 
					
					   He went round Lake Jingbo, a beauty spot in Northeast China, conducted by Dai Bingguo and other leading officials in Beijing and the locality. 
					
					 Lake Jingbo is a significant anti-Japanese battle site well known for the battle fought on its shore in November 1934 by the unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army for the first expedition to Northern Manchuria which dealt a deadly blow at the Japanese imperialist aggressors under the command of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was deeply moved to see the blue waters of the lake which seems to convey year after year the undying feats of the President who overcame the severe ordeals and trials to liberate the usurped country. 
					
					 Dai Bingguo said that the President sang Chinese famous "The Song of Su Wu" when he came to the lake during the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, adding that the Chinese people are still greatly moved and inspired by his lofty aims and heroic stamina.
					
					 Kim Jong Il came to the lake himself, called back upon the great feats of the President, shared with us the warm traditional Sino-DPRK friendship and looked far into the beautiful future of the bilateral relations, Dai Bingguo said. This greatly impressed us and made us to redouble our efforts, he added.
					
					 Kim Jong Il then went to the Hailin Farm and its dairy farm.
					
					 After being briefed on the farm at its management building he visited the dwelling house of a couple where he wished them a happy life. He then visited the dairy farm to learn in detail about breeding of cows.
					
					 He expressed the expectation that the farm built by the people from across the country in hearty response to the call of the CPC to reclaim "Beidahuang" in the 1950s would register greater success by steadily improving the management of the farm in the future, too.
					
					 Dai Bingguo hosted a grand banquet in welcome of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Dai said that Mudanjiang which has relations of long history  with the DPRK is the significant place where President Kim Il Sung conducted revolutionary activities in the 1930s and a witness of history telling that the two peoples fought against the aggressors shoulder to shoulder.
					
					 Dai said that Kim Jong Il's visit to Northeastern area of China in the wake of his last year's visit to the area shows that the party, government and people of the DPRK attach high importance to the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship, expressing the determination to keep the friendship between the two countries in full bloom forever generation after generation. Dai sincerely wished Kim Jong Il good health.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed deep thanks to Dai for showing him the utmost sincerity and providing him with conveniences accompanying him during the whole period of his last year's China visit and kindly greeting him at the border railway station far away from the capital city and giving a grand banquet this time.
					
					 Kim Jong Il received gifts presented by the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the CPC and the Heilongjiang Provincial People's Government with sincerity. 
					
					 The next leg of his visit was Changchun City, seat of Jilin Province.
					
					 He was greeted at Changchun Railway Station by leading officials of the party and government of the province and city including Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, the permanent vice-governor of the province who doubles as secretary-general of the provincial committee, and Chen Weigen, vice-governor of the province.
					
					 He visited the Northeast Changchun Core Area Construction Planning Exhibition.
					
					 Looking round the exhibition with deep attention, he highly praised the people of the province and city for working hard to achieve fresh successes in the socialist modernization drive as required by the new century by giving full play to the potentials of the area, an industrial base with a long history, under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 He visited the FAW Jiefang Automotive Company Ltd.
					
					 After being briefed on the company in the room devoted to the history of "Red Flag" car, he saw the car Kim Il Sung used during his visit to China in 1975. 
					
					 He expressed thanks to the employees of the factory for having preserved with care the above-said car for several decades with boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Going round the car assembling shop and the truck assembling shop, he learned in detail about modernization and production there.
					
					 The party and the people's government of the province and the company presented a new type "Red Flag" car produced by the company by introducing cutting-edge technology to Kim Jong Il as a gift with the best wishes for his good health as he has made endless journeys for field guidance.
					
					 The Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC arranged a grand banquet in welcome of his visit to the province.
					
					 Sun Zhengcai said that Kim Jong Il's another visit to the Northeast area of China associated with many stories about Kim Il Sung who shared weal and woe with revolutionaries of the elder generation of China while living, studying and fighting in his youth and provided the roots of Sino-DPRK friendship, would be brilliantly recorded in the history of friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 Noting that the two countries are now greeting the opportunity of important development in political, economic, cultural cooperation and other fields, Sun stressed that Jilin Province, a bridgehead of exchange and cooperation between China and the DPRK, would positively contribute to boosting friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries through active use of geographical proximity, full play to potentials and constant renovation of cooperation mode.
					
					 Kim Jong Il highly appreciated the signal successes being achieved by the province and city making rapid progress under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 The Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC and the Jilin Provincial People's Government presented him with gifts prepared with sincerity.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited Yangzhou City of Jiangsu Province, Huadong Area of China.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was greeted by leading officials of party and government of the province and the city including the secretary of the Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the CPC, the governor of the province, the secretary of the City Party Committee and the mayor of the city at Yangzhou Railway Station.
					
					 He visited an exhibition center of the Yangzhou Smart Valley, a solar energy science and technology company and a NC equipment company.
					
					 Kim Jong Il dropped in at an exhibition center of the Yangzhou Smart Valley to see typical goods produced by the Smart Valley. 
					
					 Then he went round a solar energy science and technology company and a NC equipment company. 
					
					 Going round a market in the city that day, he learned in detail about variety and quality of goods there, including fruit, vegetable and edible oil, and mode of its management. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the efforts made by the working people in the city who are making laudable successes in production and construction full of confidence and vigor. He expressed belief that the Chinese people would perform labor feats under the CPC correct leadership this year, the first year for implementing the 12th Five-Year Plan, and thus display the might of the CPC which has covered the glorious course of 90 years. 
					
					 Dai Bingguo hosted a banquet in welcome of Kim Jong Il's visit to China.
					
					 Dai said that Yangzhou City has become more famous as a typical city symbolizing the Sino-DPRK friendship because Kim Jong Il came to this beautiful city visited by President Kim Il Sung. And he paid high tribute to Kim Jong Il developing the friendly relations between the two countries generation after generation.  
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed deep thanks to Dai for the grand and significant banquet he gave again. And he wished good luck for rosier future of the city associated with unforgettable memoirs of the traditional DPRK-China friendship.   
					
					 Kim Jong Il enjoyed an art performance specially prepared by artistes of Jiangsu Province in welcome of his visit to China.
					
					 He congratulated the artistes on their successful performance and conveyed a floral basket to them.
					
					 He received gifts presented by the Yangzhou City Committee of the CPC and the Yangzhou City People's Government with best wishes.
					
					 He visited Nanjing City, the capital of Jiangsu Province.
					
					 He visited the Nanjing Panda Electronics. 
					
					 The officials and working people of the corporation, who had the honor of welcoming him to their corporation again after the lapse of 28 years, accorded him warm welcome.
					
					 Noting that the Nanjing Panda Electronics that could produce simple communication equipment only in the past has developed into a large-scale comprehensive electronics complex, he highly estimated their successes.
					
					 Then, he commanded a bird's-eye view of Nanjing City.
					
					 The Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the CPC gave a grand banquet in honor of Kim Jong Il visiting Jiangsu Province.
					
					 The secretary of the Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the CPC said that Jiangsu Province is highly proud of having President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il several times, warmly welcoming his revisit to the province on behalf of all its people.
					
					 He received gifts from the Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the CPC and the Jiangsu Provincial People's Government with best wishes.
					
					 He acquainted himself in detail with resourceful and hard-working Chinese people's thoughts and feelings, customs, history and culture, politics and economy and all other fields while touring vast land of China. 
					
					 The unofficial visit paid by him to Northeastern and Huadong regions of China for the steady development of the DPRK-China friendship proved successful thanks to the particular care and warm hospitality of Hu Jintao and the party and the government of China.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed satisfaction over the results of his visit. He expressed sincere thanks for the cordial hospitality accorded to him by leading officials and people of the C.C., the CPC, the State Council of the PRC and Heilongjiang, Jilin and Jiangsu provinces.

articles.title: Speech of Kim Jong Il at Banquet
articles.content:
Speech of Kim Jong Il at Banquet
Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Following is the full text of a speech delivered by general secretary Kim Jong Il at the banquet:
					 Esteemed Comrade General Secretary Hu Jintao,
					
					 Dear Chinese comrades,
					
					 I am very pleased to visit China again at the invitation of you, respected Comrade General Secretary, and have meaningful meetings with you and other Chinese friends.
					
					 I, first of all, would like to express deep thanks to you for having invited us to this grand banquet, though very busy with important internal and external political affairs, and made a friendly speech just before.
					
					 My thanks also go to the collective leadership of the Communist Party of China and other Chinese comrades for warmly welcoming us with comradely and friendly feelings during our tour from Heilongjiang Province, our first leg, to Beijing.
					
					 Visiting China again after nine months amid warm welcome, we have newly felt friendly feelings of the Chinese people, our close neighbor sharing a mountain and rivers with us. 
					
					 We toured northeast China where traditional DPRK-China friendship struck root, Jiangxi Province that President Kim Il Sung went round during his last China visit and other vast areas of China. During the days we have been much moved by great changes and progress made in the areas under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with you as general secretary.
					
					 We are sincerely rejoiced at the achievements of the Chinese people as at our own. 
					
					 This year is very significant for the Chinese people as they will greet the 90th anniversary of the CPC and started to carry on the 12th five-year plan for economic and social development.
					
					 We sincerely hope that the fraternal Chinese people will significantly celebrate the CPC anniversary and make greater achievements in the effort for adhering to the scientific outlook on development, defending the social stability and building a harmoniously developed socialist society under the leadership of the CPC headed by you.
					
					 The Chinese party and government are greatly contributing to rejecting high-handedness and dominationism and ensuring world peace and stability by pursuing a foreign policy sovereign and independent, under the banner of peace, development and cooperation.
					
					 All their signal successes go to clearly prove the scientific nature and invincibility of socialism. 
					
					 We are grateful to the Chinese party and government for valuing the DPRK-China relations, striving hard to develop them and always supporting the Korean people in their effort for socialist construction and the country's reunification.
					
					 We are also satisfied with a good strategic understanding between our two parties and two countries and with the proper implementation of agreements reached between us and the collective leadership of CPC in the political, economic, cultural and all other fields.
					
					 The traditional DPRK-China friendship, which has invariably displayed its great vitality even in the complicated international situation, will be further consolidated and developed in the future, powerfully propelling the just struggle of our two peoples for the common cause -- socialist construction and national reunification.
					
					 I am very happy that our China visit serves as a good occasion in putting spurs to the development of the traditional friendship between the two countries, which struck root deep in the minds of the two peoples, overcoming all trials through history.
					
					 Our party and government will as ever make every possible effort to steadily develop the bilateral friendship, a precious heritage and common treasure provided by revolutionaries of the elder generations of the two countries.
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship will be evergreen like forests of Mt, Paektu and will be continued through generations like the flow of the River Amnok.

articles.title: Speech of Hu Jintao at Banquet
articles.content:
Speech of Hu Jintao at Banquet
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Following is the full text of a speech delivered by Hu Jintao, general secretary of the C.C., the Chinese Communist Party, at the banquet arranged in honor of General Secretary Kim Jong Il:
					 Your respected Comrade General Secretary Kim Jong Il,
					
					 Dear Korean comrades,
					
					 Comrades and friends,
					
					 I, on behalf of the party, government and people of China, would like to warmly welcome you Comrade General Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on a China visit in this beautiful season full of vim and vigor.
					
					 Your current visit fully shows that you General Secretary and WPK Central Committee attach great importance to developing the Sino-DPRK friendship. The visit will help deepen strategic understanding, intensify practical cooperation and upgrade friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 Just before, Comrade General Secretary Kim Jong Il and I exchanged views over issues of common concern in a profound way and reached an important agreement.
					
					 We have shared the same views with each other as regards steadily promoting mutual strategic understanding through visits of high-ranking officials, intensifying exchange of experience in party and state building, expanding reciprocal cooperation, invigorating exchange in culture, education, sports and other fields and exchange of views over the international and regional situation and other major issues and taking a joint action.
					
					 The Chinese party and government have consistently maintained and propelled the Sino-DPRK friendship and cooperation in a far-sighted way and on a strategic level. It is our unshakable policy to consolidate and develop the traditional friendship.   
					
					 We, together with the Korean comrades, will steadily develop the bilateral friendship and cooperation in the spirit of inheriting tradition, facing up to the future, building good neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation. In this way, we will work hard to accelerate socialist construction in the two countries, promote interests common to the two sides and defend and promote the peace, stability and prosperity of the region.
					
					 The industrious and resourceful Korean people are now working hard to develop the economy, improve the people's living standard and build a thriving nation to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 We, as a friendly neighbor, comrade and true friend of Korea, sincerely hope that the Korean people, under the leadership of you General Secretary, will attain the targets of various sectors, explore a way of development suitable for the actual conditions of the country and make fresh and greater achievements in the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Returns Home after Paying Unofficial Visit to China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Returns Home after Paying Unofficial Visit to China 
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Friday returned home after successfully wrapping up his unofficial visit to the PRC. 
					 He was warmly greeted at the border of the country by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK; Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK; Ri Myong Su, minister of People's Security; Generals of the Korean People's Army Kim Won Hong and Hyon Chol Hae and other senior officials of the party and army. 
					
					 The senior officials of the party and army warmly congratulated him on his successful visit to China, offering the unanimous best wishes of the entire army and people to him who made a safe return home after adding another brilliant page to the history of the DPRK-China friendship by making a 6 000 km-long journey. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il met with the officials present there and extended a warm salute to all the beloved people of the country upon his return home. 
					
					 Earlier, he passed through Dandong, a border city of China. 
					
					 He was warmly seen off at Dandong Railway Station by Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Wang Min, secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the CPC; Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK; Hu Yadong, vice-minister of Railways; the secretary-general of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the CPC; the vice-governor and concurrently chief of Public Security of Liaoning Province, the assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC; Dai Yulin, secretary of the Dandong City Committee of the CPC; and the acting mayor of Dandong City.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Hu Jintao
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Thursday sent a message of thanks to Hu Jintao, general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China.
					 The message said:
					
					 On my way home after successfully winding up the visit to the PRC, a friendly neighbor, I express deep thanks to you and close comrades of the CPC collective leadership and officials and people of Beijing and localities for the warm welcome and cordial hospitality accorded to us.
					
					 This time we toured Jilin and Heilongjiang provinces, where the DPRK-China friendship took its historic root and unforgettable memoirs are associated, and Jiangsu Province and Beijing of China. During the visit we realized the invincible vitality of the DPRK-China friendship daily growing stronger century after century and deeply felt again the Chinese people's warm friendship toward us.
					
					 We were deeply moved and greatly encouraged to see at first hand the sagacious and industrious Chinese people make signal achievements in building socialism with Chinese characteristics this meaningful year, which marks the 90th birthday of the CPC and the first year for carrying out the 12th Five-Year Plan.
					
					 Being satisfied at the fact that you and I reached a good agreement of views on all matters of mutual concern in the recent meeting and talks, I express belief that the DPRK-China friendship, sealed in blood and handed down by the elder generations of the two countries, will develop steadily through generations in the common interests and wishes of the two peoples.
					
					 I heartily wish that the fraternal Chinese people would register greater successes in the cause of achieving the prosperity of China under the correct guidance of the CPC with you as its general secretary and thus adorn the 90th anniversary of the CPC and that you would enjoy good health.

articles.title: American Young-su Jun Released
articles.content:
American Young-su Jun Released 
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- As already reported, American Young-su Jun has been under investigation by a relevant institution after he was arrested in Nov. 2010 on charges of anti-DPRK crime.
					 The investigation proved that Jun committed serious crime against the DPRK which he frankly admitted himself.
					
					 Robert King, special envoy for Human Rights and Humanitarian Issues, U.S. State Department on a visit to the DPRK, expressed regret at the incident on behalf of the U.S. government and assured that it would make all its efforts to prevent the recurrence of similar incident. Earlier, former U.S. President Jimmy Carter and Reverend Franklin Graham visited the DPRK and repeatedly asked it to leniently pardon him. Taking all this into account, the DPRK government decided to set him free from the humanitarian stand.
					
					 During his detention, the DPRK allowed him to make regular contacts with the consul of the Swedish embassy representing the U.S. interests in the DPRK as well as correspondence and phone call with his family. It also gave him hospital treatment for his health reason.

articles.title: DPRK's Will to Remain True to Idea and Principle of NAM Clarified
articles.content:
DPRK's Will to Remain True to Idea and Principle of NAM Clarified
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will as ever creditably fulfill its mission and responsibility for invariably adhering to the idea and principle of the Non-aligned Movement (NAM) and embodying them, said head of the DPRK delegation Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, addressing the meeting of non-aligned foreign ministers on May 25.
					 The NAM made a great contribution to meeting all challenges of history and overcoming difficulties, safeguarding the global peace and security and protecting the collective rights and interests of its member nations, he noted.
					
					  He referred to the fact that President Kim Il Sung deemed it as the basic mission of the NAM to build a new free and peaceful world long ago and made indefatigable efforts for its development and unity and cooperation among its member nations.
					
					 Since its very inception the NAM has always paid a deep attention to solving the issue on the Korean Peninsula and positively supported and encouraged the DPRK government and its people in the efforts for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and ensuring lasting peace on the peninsula, he noted, and went on:
					
					 It is the stand and the main purpose of dialogue to defuse the tension, build confidence and head for reconciliation, cooperation and peace through dialogue and negotiations under the situation where hostile relations persist between the DPRK and the U.S. and the north and the south.
					
					 These efforts of the DPRK, however, have failed to receive due response.
					
					 The U.S. is shunning dialogue with a variety of pre-conditions and persistently posing a nuclear threat to the DPRK and putting sanctions and pressure upon it.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities are becoming evermore undisguised in their moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and ignite a war against it in collusion with the outside forces, persistently denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 It is the DPRK's stand to react to dialogue with dialogue and sanctions with a tough policy.
					
					 Pak expressed deep thanks to the member nations of the NAM for having extended support to the Korean people in their just cause of defending peace on the peninsula and reunifying the country and expressed expectation and belief that they would continue to extend solidarity to them, in the future, too.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its stand to develop the NAM and achieve global independence, he stressed.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Ethiopia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Girma Wolde-Giorgis, president of Ethiopia, on the 20th anniversary of its national day.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and the people of Ethiopia greater success in the efforts for the development and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 He also expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two counties would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: Congratulations to FM of Mali
articles.content:
Congratulations to FM of Mali
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Soumeylou Boubeye Maiga upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Mali.
					 The message wished him success in his new work, expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: New Electronic Cards Developed
articles.content:
New Electronic Cards Developed
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Information Center developed electronic cards for various uses like payment, pass and access to public catering establishments and libraries.
					 The cards are well received for their high security.
					
					 The center has built a facility for massproducing electronic cards.

articles.title: Public Service Facilities in Kaeson Youth Park
articles.content:
Public Service Facilities in Kaeson Youth Park
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Public service facilities like soft drink stand, pancake house and bakery in the Kaeson Youth Park draw many people.
					 Kangryong green tea and black tea are popular in the soft drink stand.
					
					 The bakery serves different kinds of bread famous in other countries.
					
					 Toasted bun stuffed with seasoned meat and vegetables, fried vegetables and roast chestnuts and sweet potatoes are also available in the park.

articles.title: Korean Sports Supporting Fund
articles.content:
Korean Sports Supporting Fund
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Korean Sports Supporting Fund has invigorated cooperation with local and foreign institutions and overseas Koreans. 
					 The fund encourages many people, including women and children, to take part in sports activities and helps train athletes and coaches and improve sports education.
					
					 Founded in April Juche 95 (2006), it is a certified public institution of the DPRK.
					
					 As the supreme leading body of the fund, the General Assembly adopts and revises documents concerning the fund's activities and elects the board of directors.
					
					 The president of the fund, Ri Hye Gyong, told KCNA that the board of directors has a secretariat which includes departments of information, project cooperation, finance and commendation of donators.
					
					 "I hope that local people, overseas Koreans and foreign organizations and individuals will contribute to the sports development of the DPRK," she said.
					
					 The fund is located in Puksae-dong, Moranbong District, Pyongyang.

articles.title: Superior Korean Language
articles.content:
Superior Korean Language
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the DPRK observed the 45th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Correctly Preserving the National Characteristics of the Korean Language."
					 The Korean language is rich in pronunciation and expression.
					
					 The language has 19 consonants and 21 vowels, 40 in all.
					
					 It makes it possible to correctly pronounce any difficult and complicated words and properly express delicate feelings and subtle differences between things.
					
					 The Korean language provides favorable conditions for pronouncing other languages distinctly.
					
					 It has different tones and good intonation so that it sounds beautiful.
					
					 The distribution rate of the open syllables in practice is some 65 percent.
					
					 The pronunciation rules are also well framed.

articles.title: Saplings of Good Species Bred in DPRK
articles.content:
Saplings of Good Species Bred in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Saplings of good species have been cultivated on a large scale in the DPRK.
					 The Ministry of Urban Management has cultivated saplings in a large nursery and supplied them to all provinces.
					
					 Millions of saplings are growing in the nursery.
					
					 Nursery stations and nurseries across the country also cultivate saplings necessary for town greening in an extensive way.
					
					 The Sangwon Sapling Production Station is raising ginkgo, zelkova, juniper and many other species of trees and flowers.
					
					 Sapling producers are now weeding and manuring nurseries after finishing sowing.

articles.title: Situation Deteriorates at Fukushima Power Plant of Japan
articles.content:
Situation Deteriorates at Fukushima Power Plant of Japan 
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Meltdown is ceaselessly occurring at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan, deteriorating the situation there. 
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. in a report released Tuesday said that meltdown took place at reactors Nos. 2 and 3 just as it happened at reactor No.1.
					
					 According to the report, the melted fuel is believed to have been kept cool at the bottom of the pressure vessels.
					
					 As regards the continuous meltdown, the prime minister's aide said that the government felt responsibility for its earlier hasty assessment of the situation caused by the accident. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Tokyo Shimbun on May 25 said quoting an analysis by TEPCO that breaches may have occurred at containment vessels encasing the Nos. 1 and 2 reactors at the power plant, possibly causing leaks of highly radioactive water there. 
					
					 The paper said that if it hypothesizes that a breach about 3 centimeters wide occurred at the No. 1 reactor's containment vessel 18 hours after the quake and it widened to about 7 cm 50 hours after the quake, that corresponds well to changes in pressure readings inside the containment vessel. The company also hypothesized that a breach roughly 10 cm wide occurred at the No. 2 reactor's containment  vessel 21 hours after the quake due to elevated temperatures, among other factors, finding that it also corresponds with data obtained, it said. 
					
					I t suggested that at the No. 3 reactor of the plant its main steam piping has been damaged and steam leaked from the pressure vessel. 
					
					 At a time when there is growing concern due to the radiation crisis in different parts of Japan, traces of radioactive substances were detected in the air in Hokkaido.

articles.title: Japan's Settlement of Past Urged at Int'l Meeting
articles.content:
Japan's Settlement of Past Urged at Int'l Meeting
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- A seminar on Japan's settlement of past and distortion of textbooks and cultural artifacts looted by it and a coordinating meeting of the International Solidarity Council Demanding Settlement of Japan's Past took place in Beijing on May 13 and 14.
					 Present there were representatives and personages of organizations from countries and regions involved in the International Solidarity Council, including the DPRK, China and Netherlands.
					
					 Speakers at the seminar cited facts to disclose that the crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists after their aggression on Asian countries have been justified, concealed and downplayed and Tok Islets of Korea are described as Japan's territory in the textbooks of secondary schools being examined and passed by the Japanese government.
					
					 They disclosed that the Japanese imperialists occupied Korea by force and destroyed or plundered its cultural properties during their colonial military and fascist rule, denouncing the wrong attitude and stand of the Japanese government which has refused to send back those cultural artifacts even though 66 years have passed since the defeat of Japanese imperialism.
					
					 They stressed the need to carry out dynamic actions to make the Japanese government thoroughly investigate and make public the Korean cultural properties and send them back according to the requirements of international law.
					
					 The coordinating meeting informed the activities conducted by several countries and organizations demanding Japan's settlement of its past.
					
					 The International Solidarity Council discussed and decided several action programs, too. They included the issue of conducting international solidarity activities aimed at wresting apologies and compensation from the Japanese government for the past crimes against humanity until 2015, the 70th anniversary of the defeat of the Japanese imperialists and the issue of setting the month of the international solidarity activities demanding Japan's settlement of the past on the occasion of August 15 this year and conducting intensive activities.  Issues on disclosing the moves of the Japanese authorities and the right-wing reactionaries evading the responsibilities for the past crimes, increasing the ranks of the International Solidarity Council and putting great vitality into the activities of the organizations were also included in the programs.

articles.title: Retraction of S. Korean Authorities' Measures to Escalate Confrontation
articles.content:
Retraction of S. Korean Authorities' Measures to Escalate Confrontation
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Members of religious, civic and public organizations and lawmakers from opposition parties in south Korea held a press conference at the "National Assembly" on May 24 at which they demanded an immediate retraction of the unreasonable measures for totally blocking exchange between the north and the south, south Korean KBS reported.
					 The "May 24 step" taken by the authorities in the wake of the "Cheonan" warship case is a major factor that brought the inter-Korean relations to collapse and pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula back to the state of the Cold War, they noted, and continued:
					
					 This step hit hard the south Korean enterprises.
					
					  The "government" should positively opt for improving the inter-Korean relations by beginning with the retraction of the "May 24 step", the bankrupt policy.

articles.title: Another Criminal Deed by U.S. Forces in S. Korea Disclosed
articles.content:
Another Criminal Deed by U.S. Forces in S. Korea Disclosed
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in south Korea buried poisonous materials in their base in Ojong-dong, Puchon City, Kyonggi Province, according to the south Korean Yonhap News on May 24.
					 This fact was disclosed through an Internet article posted by an American who served in the base from July 1963 to April 1964 as a soldier of the 547th Company of the 44th CB of the U.S. Engineer Corps.
					
					 In the article he confessed that hundreds of gals of chemical substances, rubber clothes, masks, etc. were buried at that time.
					
					 He also said that the U.S. forces' repository of chemicals in the base was moved to the Waegwan military base in around March-April 1964.

articles.title: Total Survey into U.S. Military Bases Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Total Survey into U.S. Military Bases Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on May 23 urging a total survey into the U.S. military bases in south Korea.
					 The burial of defoliant in the Waegwan U.S. military base is not a mere crime, it said.
					
					 It is essential to survey all the U.S. military bases in south Korea with this case as a momentum, the commentary said, adding that the south Korea-U.S. SOFA should be revised to prevent such action as burial and crimes by the U.S. troops.
					
					 The Headquarters of the Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces in south Korea, too, issued a commentary on May 20 in which it called for surveying not only the Waegwan base but also all other U.S. military bases across south Korea and opening to the public the truth about the U.S. forces' crimes.
					
					 More serious is the fact that there is suspicion that what the U.S. forces buried in the base might be not only defoliant but nuclear waste, it said.
					
					 Different social circles are now strongly demanding a thoroughgoing investigation into the defoliant burial case, according to south Korea's KBS on May 24.

articles.title: Iran Rejects U.S. Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Rejects U.S. Sanctions
 Tehran, May 25 (KCNA) -- The head of the Iranian Parliament National Security and Foreign Policy Commission in an interview with a news agency on May 23 denounced the U.S. for its persistent sanctions against his country.
					 The U.S. said in its recent statement that it had frozen the assets of the Iranian Bank of Industry and Mines for its alleged involvement in facilitating transactions to support Iran's proliferation activities and suspected nuclear program.
					
					 "We have always faced the problem of sanctions and embargos over last 30 years, but Iran will continue its way with increased momentum," he said.
					
					 "Americans are aware that those who impose sanctions are the major losers," he noted.

articles.title: Ceaseless U.S. Drone Strike on Pakistan
articles.content:
Ceaseless U.S. Drone Strike on Pakistan
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are ceaselessly committing drone strike on Pakistan under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least seven people were killed in a U.S. drone missile strike launched Monday evening in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: Iran Accuses West of Its Wrong View
articles.content:
Iran Accuses West of Its Wrong View
 Tehran, May 25 (KCNA) -- Leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei in a talk Sunday critically abused the West's wrong perspective on the position of women in society. 
					 Women are target of exploitation in the West's society, he said, adding that misconceptions are driving the settlement of the issue of woman in the world into a crisis.
					
					 The Iranian government will make positive efforts to oppose such conception and attitude of the West's society and enhance the position and role of women, he stressed.

articles.title: African Countries Strengthen Cooperation in Security Field
articles.content:
African Countries Strengthen Cooperation in Security Field
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Sudan, Chad and Central Africa
					at a summit meeting on May 23 published a final communique on establishment of joint forces to protect joint borders.
					
					 The establishment is aimed to strengthen cooperation among the tripartite countries in combating smuggling and cross-border criminal activities.

articles.title: Iran Bolsters Missile Forces
articles.content:
Iran Bolsters Missile Forces
 Tehran, May 25 (KCNA) -- Iran is continuing to direct big efforts to strengthening missile forces.
					 Iran has begun supplying Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guards with the Qiyam surface to surface missile system, according to its defense minister.
					
					 He said that the mass production of the missile system proves Iran is becoming self-sufficient in its missile production capability.

articles.title: Different Countries Hit by Natural Disasters
articles.content:
Different Countries Hit by Natural Disasters 
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) --There is unusual heat in different areas of China these days.
					 Entering this year, the temperature has reached the highest level in central eastern areas as of May 24 and it registered as high as 40 degrees centigrade in some areas.
					
					 It is foreseen that the heat which started in the southern areas on May 19 will last in the future and the scale of the areas affected by it will expand.
					
					 Damage by drought which hit Hubei Province from the end of last year is increasing.
					
					 According to information available from the Civil Administration Agency of the province, the area of the drought-stricken cropland increased to 18 million wu as of May 23 and water in reservoirs decreased drastically.
					
					 Forest fire continues occurring in Russia, causing damage.
					
					 According to the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation, forest fire occurred in 418 places of the country on May 23 alone and its area reached more than 110 500 hectares.
					
					 The area damaged by forest fire in Siberia reached 2 240 hectares on May 22.
					
					 Torrential rain and storm hit Uttar Pradesh State, India killing 42 people and injuring 50 others as of May 22, leaving houses destroyed and bringing down power cables.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Philippines, Papua New Guinea
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Philippines, Papua New Guinea
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- A 5.7-magnitude earthquake jolted Mindoro Island, Philippines on May 23. 
					 The epicenter was waters off the western area of the island.
					
					 On May 21 a 5.8-magnitude earthquake hit eastern New Guinea region of Morobe in Papua New Guinea.
					
					 The epicenter was 252 km north of Port Moresby.

articles.title: Roadside Bomb Kills 4 NATO Soldiers in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Roadside Bomb Kills 4 NATO Soldiers in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths due to the attack of resistance forces of the country.
					 A roadside bomb killed four service members from the NATO in Afghanistan's volatile east on Monday.

articles.title: CMCC Issues Legislative Program
articles.content:
CMCC Issues Legislative Program 
 Beijing, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Military Commission of China issued a legislative program recently to be implemented during the period of the 12th Five-Year Plan. 
					 The program puts main emphasis on establishing a legislative system necessary for strengthening the political and ideological building, further perfecting the preparedness of the army to go into action and uniting the army and the people according to the general directive of the CMCC on the army building and development during the period of the 12th Five-Year Plan.

articles.title: Chinese Commerce Minister on Rise in Food Price
articles.content:
Chinese Commerce Minister on Rise in Food Price
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Chinese minister of Commerce referred to the rise in food price, speaking at the recent trade ministers' meeting of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation.
					 He said that the radical rise in food price worldwide in recent years is mainly due to the overproduction of biological energy and unreasonable currency policies in some countries.
					
					 APEC should naturally solve this fundamental problem essential for ensuring food security, he said.

articles.title: Cuba Sentences Prison Term to Terrorist
articles.content:
Cuba Sentences Prison Term to Terrorist
 Havana, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Supreme Court passed a sentence of 30 years' imprisonment on Francisco Antonio Chavez Abarca recently indicted for terrorism. 
					 All data and documents, brought up by the court, showed that he attempted to implant bombs in hotel and other tourist facilities of Cuba and trained the hired agents for such action while giving financial assistance. 
					
					 Abarca was reported to be the boss of an armed group Posada Carriles, an international terrorist, organized under the wire-pulling of the United State with an aim to create unrest and fear among the Cuban people.

articles.title: Remains of Allende Unearthed in Chile
articles.content:
Remains of Allende Unearthed in Chile
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Remains of Salvador Allende, who was president of the country and an adherent to socialism, were unearthed from the General Cemetery of Santiago in Chile on Monday to probe the cause of his death.
					 He died at the time of the bloody military coup staged by the Pinochet clique in 1973.
					
					 Present at the unearthing were personages of leftist parities including the Communist Party of Chile and representatives of human rights organizations.
					
					 It is reported that the Chilean Court decided in January to make investigation to probe into the cause of Allende's death and settle 726 lawsuits filed against human rights abuses committed during the Pinochet dictatorial regime.

articles.title: Peaceful Nuclear Projects underway in Latin America
articles.content:
Peaceful Nuclear Projects underway in Latin America
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The work for developing and using the peaceful nuclear energy is making headway in Latin America and the Caribbean.
					 72 nuclear development projects for peaceful purposes have been carried out in Latin America and the Caribbean, according to Casas, director of the International Atomic Energy Agency's Technical Cooperation Division for Latin America, on May 23.
					
					  Since 1984, 133 million dollars have been invested to promote nuclear energy with peaceful objectives, he said.

articles.title: Development of Education in DPRK Introduced by Ukraine Organization
articles.content:
Development of Education in DPRK Introduced by Ukraine Organization
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Ukrainian Independence Federation posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Development of Education in DPRK in New Century" on May 21.
					 The article noted that general secretary Kim Jong Il visited Kim Il Sung University in December 1996 marking its 50th birthday and gave meaningful instructions in relation to the education.
					
					 Under his meticulous care the state investment in education has increased and the whole country is positively supporting the education in the DPRK, it said.
					
					 In recent years the DPRK has made world-startling achievements one after another in all fields of science and technology, including nuclear, outer space, information, nano and bioengineering technologies, holding supremacy over the CNC technology, it said, adding: This shows that there are so many well-qualified talents in the country.
					
					 The DPRK will emerge a great prosperous and powerful country in the near future along with the development of education in the new century, the article stressed.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organization on Study of Juche Idea
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organization on Study of Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre released a statement on May 19 in support of the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and the appeal to the Juche idea followers of the world adopted at the Latin American regional seminar on the Juche idea.
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea to clearly show the road ahead of the times and humankind and made signal contribution to global independence with his distinguished and seasoned leadership, the statement said, adding: It will be a historic event for the progressive people to commemorate the centenary of his birth with splendor.
					
					 It went on to say:
					
					 We will strive to deeply study and apply the Juche idea and the spirit of self-reliance in practice and build an independent new world.
					
					 We call on the Juche idea followers to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and thus greatly contribute to global independence.

articles.title: Feat Lauded by Uruguayan and Pakistani Newspapers
articles.content:
Feat Lauded by Uruguayan and Pakistani Newspapers
 Pyongyang, May 27 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Uruguay and Pakistan dedicated articles to the 65th anniversary of the ground-breaking ceremony of the Pothong River improvement project in which President Kim Il Sung spaded up the earth himself.
					 The La Juventud of Uruguay on May 20 carried the beaming image of Kim Il Sung and an article titled "Korea, First Torch of Nature Remaking, 65th anniversary of the Pothong River Improvement Project".
					
					 It noted that after the liberation the President initiated the project and participated in the ground-breaking ceremony to spade the earth personally on May 21, 1946.
					
					 Under his brilliant leadership the great project was successfully completed in a short span of 55 days, turning the Pothong River into the one of happiness, the article noted.
					
					 The article said that the work to build the country on the long-term plan has been vigorously underway everywhere in the DPRK, stressing that the country has gained greater successes in the nature-harnessing project in the course of materializing general secretary Kim Jong Il's plan for the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 The Baluchistan Times of Pakistan on May 18 said that May 21 this year is the 65th anniversary of Kim Il Sung's spading up the earth at the ceremony for starting the Pothong River improvement project and carried an article to introduce it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita regiones de Nordeste y Huadong de China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita regiones de Nordeste y Huadong de China
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizo del dia 20 al 26 una visita extraoficial a la Republica Popular China cumplimentando la invitacion de Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la RPCh.
					 Le acompanaron al Dirigente Kim Ki Nam y Choe Thae Bok, miembros del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Ji Jae Ryong, embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario coreano acreditado en China.
					
					 Los lideres del partido y el Estado de China y el pueblo chino dieron calurosa bienvenida al Dirigente, quien volvio a visitar a su pais a los 9 meses con la profunda amistad sobre el hermano pueblo chino, y le trataron con toda sinceridad. 
					
					 El Dirigente visito las regiones del Nordeste y Huadong de China. 
					
					 Le acogio con hospitalidad en la estacion ferroviaria fronteriza el consejero de Estado de la RPCh, Dai Bingguo, por encargo del Secretario General Hu Jintao y el Comite Central del PCCh. 
					
					 Tambien le acogieron el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Wang Jiarui, el ministro del Ferrocarril, Sheng Guangzu, el secretario del Comite Provincial del PCCh en Jilin, Sun Zhengcai, el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario chino en Corea, Liu Hongcai y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el gobierno en el centro y los ministerios de China.
					
					  Le obsequiaron ramos de flores fragantes lindos ninos chinos.
					
					 El Dirigente se reunio y departio con Dai Bingguo.
					
					 Dai Bingguo dio calurosa bienvenida al Dirigente en nombre del Secretario General Hu Jintao, el CC del PCCh y el Consejo de Estado de la RPCh.

articles.title: Discurso de Kim Jong Il en el banquete de bienvenida
articles.content:
Discurso de Kim Jong Il en el banquete de bienvenida
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- Abajo va el texto integro del discurso pronunciado por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el banquete de bienvenida:
					 Estimado camarada Secretario General Hu Jintao,
					
					 Entranables camaradas chinos,
					
					 Estoy muy contento de volver a visitar a China por la invitacion cordial del estimado camarada Secretario General Hu Jintao y de sostener este encuentro significativo con el y otros camaradas chinos hermanos.
					
					 Ante todo, quisiera expresar mi profundo agradecimiento al Secretario General Hu Jintao que ofrecio este banquete opiparo para nosotros a pesar de que esta muy ocupado y le esperan muchos importantes problemas politicos nacionales e internacionales a atender, y acaba de pronunciar ahora un discurso de desbordante sentimiento de amistad.
					
					 Igualmente, agradezco a la direccion central del partido chino y a los camaradas chinos que nos tratan con amistad y hospitalidad desde la provincia de Heilongjiang, primer destino de nuestra visita, hasta Beijing.
					
					 Volvimos a visitar a China a los 9 meses y sentimos nuevamente la especial amistad del pueblo chino, buen vecino y hermano cuyas montanas y rios estan unidos con los de Corea, recibiendo el trato hospitalario.
					
					 Sobre todo, pisando la region Nordeste donde se echaron las raices historicas de la tradicional amistad Corea-China, la provincia de Jiangsu visitada por el camarada Presidente Kim Il Sung en su ultima visita a China y otras zonas extensas de China, nos quedamos muy impresionados al ver directamente el gran cambio y el desarrollo que se registran por doquier del pais bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China encabezado por el estimado camarada Hu Jintao.
					
					 Estamos sinceramente alegres de los exitos del pueblo chino considerandolos como los propios.
					
					 Este ano resulta muy significativo para el pueblo chino porque se acoge el 90o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido Comunista de China y comienza el ambicioso proyecto incluido en el 12o plan quinquenal para el desarrollo de economia nacional y sociedad.
					
					 Deseamos de todo corazon que bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China encabezado por el camarada Secretario General Hu Jintao, el hermano pueblo chino celebre significativamente el 90o aniversario de la fundacion de esta organizacion, materialice la concepcion cientifica de desarrollo, defienda la estabilidad social y logre mayores exitos en la lucha posterior por construir una sociedad socialista armoniosa. 
					
					 Hoy en dia, el partido y el gobierno de China contribuyen grandemente a rechazar el autoritarismo y el dominacionismo y a preservar la paz y la estabilidad del mundo manteniendose en su politica diplomatica independiente y soberana bajo la bandera de la paz, el desarrollo y la cooperacion.
					
					 Todos estos exitos orgullosos del Partido Comunista de China y el pueblo chino comprueban en si mismos el caracter cientifico e invencible del socialismo.
					
					 Estamos agradecidos de que el partido y el gobierno de China apreciaran las relaciones Corea-China, se esforzaran dinamicamente por el fortalecimiento y el desarrollo de ellas y enviaran siempre su apoyo y solidaridad a la lucha del pueblo coreano por construir el socialismo y realizar la reunificacion del pais.
					
					 Sobre todo, estamos complacidos de que se estrechara la comunicacion de opiniones estrategicas entre ambos partidos y paises y se materializaran bien los espiritus de acuerdos logrados entre nosotros y la direccion central del Partido Comunista de China en todos los sectores como la politica, la economia y la cultura.
					
					 La tradicional amistad Corea-China, que demuestra su enorme vitalidad aun bajo la complicada situacion internacional, se consolidara y se desarrollara mas en lo adelante y estimulara mas energeticamente la justa lucha de los pueblos de ambos paises por cumplir la causa comun: la construccion del socialismo y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					 Me alegro mucho de que nuestra visita a China haya sido una oportunidad magnifica para desarrollar mas vigorosamente las tradicionales relaciones de amistad Corea-China, arraigada en el corazon de los pueblos de ambos paises, superando todas las pruebas de la historia.
					
					  El Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno de la RPDC se esforzaran en todo lo posible por seguir consolidando y desarrollando la amistad Corea-China, patrimonio comun y valiosa herencia que nos legaron los revolucionarios de generacion veterana de ambos paises.
					
					 La amistad Corea-China mantendra siempre su verdor al igual que las selvas virgenes del monte Paektu y se fortalecera y continuara de generacion en generacion como la corriente impetuosa del rio Amnok.

articles.title: Discurso de Hu Jintao en el banquete de bienvenida
articles.content:
Discurso de Hu Jintao en el banquete de bienvenida
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- El texto integral del discurso del Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Hu Jintao, pronunciado en el banquete de bienvenida es el siguiente:
					 Estimado camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il, 
					
					 Intimos camaradas coreanos,
					
					 Camaradas y amigos, 
					
					 En representacion del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de China, le expreso mi calurosa bienvenida al camarada Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, por su visita a China en esta estacion hermosa palpitante de vigor y animo.
					
					 Esta visita, que manifiesta suficientemente que el camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il y el Comite Central del PTC aprecian al maximo el desarrollo de la amistad China-Corea, intensificara el intercambio de opiniones estrategicas, profundiza la cooperacion practica entre los dos paises y llevara a la altura mas elevada las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea. 
					
					 Hace un momento he intercambiado con el camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il las opiniones profundas sobre los problemas de interes comun y hemos llegado al consenso importante.
					
					  Acordamos el problema de intensificar la visita de alto nivel entre los dos paises y profundizar constantemente el intercambio de opiniones estrategicas, el de fortalecer el intercambio de experiencias sobre la construccion del partido y el Estado, el de ampliar la cooperacion de beneficio mutuo, el de profundizar el intercambio en varias ramas como la cultura, la educacion y los deportes, e intensificar el intercambio de opiniones y tomar acciones conjuntas en el trato de los importantes problemas internacionales y regionales. 
					
					  El partido y el gobierno de China mantienen siempre con perspectivas y en la altura estrategica las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con Corea y las defienden y promueven y consideran como su firme orientacion consolidar y desarrollar la tradicional amistad China-Corea.
					
					  Haremos ingentes esfuerzos junto con los camaradas coreanos por promover bien la construccion socialista de los dos paises y los intereses comunes de ambas partes y defender y acelerar la paz, la estabilidad y la prosperidad de la region, dando impulso al desarrollo sostenido de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea a base del espiritu de continuacion de tradicion, aspiracion al futuro, buena vecindad y fortalecimiento de cooperacion. 
					
					  Hoy dia, el pueblo coreano diligente e inteligente libra una lucha energica por lograr la meta de abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente          Kim Il Sung, mediante el desarrollo de la economia y la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo.
					
					  Nosotros, siendo intimos vecinos, camaradas y amigos sinceros, deseamos de todo corazon que bajo la guia del camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano cumpla satisfactoriamente las tareas de varios dominios, estudie la via de desarrollo conveniente a la realidad de su pais y logre incesantemente los exitos nuevos y mayores en el camino por la construccion de la gran potencia prospera.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il regresa a la patria tras visita extraoficial a China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il regresa a la patria tras visita extraoficial a China
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, regreso el dia 27 a la patria luego de terminar con exito la visita extraoficial a la Republica Popular China.
					 Le acogieron cordialmente en la frontera     Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central de PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Myong Su, ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, Kim Won Hong y Hyon Chol Hae, generales de ejercito del Ejercito Popular de Corea y otros funcionarios directivos del partido y el ejercito.
					
					 Ellos rindieron el saludo de votos al Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien regreso con buena salud tras registrar una brillante pagina en los anales de amistad Corea-China en la larga trayectoria de 15 mil ries y felicitaron ardientemente el exito de su visita a China, reflejando unanime alma de todo el ejercito y el pueblo.
					
					 El Dirigente se reunio con los funcionarios directivos del partido y el ejercito y envio el cordial saludo de regreso a todo el pueblo de la patria.
					
					 Con anterioridad, el Dirigente paso por Dandong, ciudad fronteriza de China.
					
					 El Dirigente fue despedido en la estacion ferroviaria de Dandong por el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Wang Jiarui, el secretario del Comitedel Partido Comunista de China en la Provincia de Liaoning, Wang Min, el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario chino en Corea Liu Hongcai, el viceministro de Ferrocarriles Hu Yadong, el secretario general del Comite del Partido Comunista de China en la misma Provincia, el vicegobernador y jefe de Seguridad Publica de la provincia de Liaoning, el asistente del jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, el secretario del Comite del PCCh en la ciudad de Dandong, Dai Yuling, y el alcalde interino de Dandong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de agradecimiento a Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de agradecimiento a Hu Jintao
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 26 el mensaje de agradecimiento a Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la Republica Popular China.
					 El texto completo sigue:
					
					 En este momento de regreso tras concluir exitosamente nuestra visita a la RPCh, vecino amistoso, expreso profundo agradecimiento a Vd., los camaradas entranables de la direccion central del Partido Comunista de China, los cuadros del centro y localidades y al pueblo chino que nos recibieron cordialmente y nos trataron hospitalariamente,.
					
					 Volvimos a sentir profundamente la inagotable vitalidad de la amistad Corea-China, que se amplia y se fortalece de siglo en siglo, y el calido sentimiento de amistad del pueblo chino, visitando las provincias de Jilin, Heilongjiang, Jiangsu y Beijing de China donde se echaron raices historicas de la amistad Corea-China y se conservan recuerdos gratos.
					
					 Nos quedamos profundamente impresionados y estimulados al ver al inteligente y diligente pueblo chino que logra enormes exitos en la construccion del socialismo con peculiaridades chinas en este ano significativo en que se acoge el 90o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido Comunista de China y comienza el cumplimiento del 12o plan quinquenal.
					
					 Satisfecho de que en los encuentros y las conversaciones de esta vez se ha logrado un magnifico consenso con Vd. en todos los problemas de interes mutuo abordados, expreso la conviccion de que la amistad Corea-China, preparada con sangre y legada por los revolucionarios de generacion veterana de ambos paises, se fortalecera y se desarrollara invariablemente de generacion en generacion conforme a los intereses y deseo comunes de los pueblos de ambos paises.
					
					 Formulo sinceros votos por hacer que el hermano pueblo chino celebre con brillantez el 90o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido Comunista de China al alcanzar mayores exitos en la causa por la prosperidad de China bajo la correcta guia de esa organizacion, que le tiene a Vd. como su Secretario General, y por la buena salud de Vd.

articles.title: Liberado ciudadano norteamericano Young-su Jun
articles.content:
Liberado ciudadano norteamericano Young-su Jun
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- Como ya trascendidos, el ciudadano estadounidense Young-su Jun fue sometido a la investigacion de un organo competente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tras ser detenido en noviembre de 2010 por el cargo de haber cometido en el territorio coreano un acto criminal anti-RPDC.
					 Segun el resultado de investigacion, ha sido confirmado su grave acto criminal contra la RPDC y el reconocio francamente su culpabilidad.
					
					 Robert King, enviado especial encargado de los derechos humanos y asuntos humanitarios del Departamento de Estado de EE.UU., que se encuentra de visita en Corea, expreso lastima por lo ocurrido en representacion del gobierno norteamericano y prometio hacer todo lo posible por prevenir la repeticion de casos semejantes.
					
					 Anteriormente, el ex presidente Jimmy Carter y el pastor Franklin Graham de EE.UU. pidieron repetidamente que perdonaran al culpable con magnanimidad.
					
					 Tomando en consideracion tal solicitud, el gobierno de la RPDC decidio liberar y devolver a Young-su Jun desde el punto de vista humanitario.
					
					 Durante la retencion de Young-su Jun, se le facilitaron el contacto consular normal de la embajada de Suecia en Corea, que representa los intereses de EE.UU. en Corea, el intercambio de cartas y llamadas telefonicas con sus familiares y la asistencia medica en un hospital.

articles.title: RPDC mantendra ideal y principios del MNOAL, ratifica Pak Ui Chun
articles.content:
RPDC mantendra ideal y principios del MNOAL, ratifica Pak Ui Chun
 Pyongyang, 27 de mayo (ATCC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, quien preside a la delegacion coreana, reafirmo que en el futuro tambien, el gobierno de la RPDC mantendra invariablemente el ideal y los principios del Movimiento de los Paises No Alineados y cumplira toda su mision y responsabilidad en la implementacion de ellos. 
					 Al intervenir el dia 25 en la reunion de cancilleres del MNOAL, Pak senalo que ese movimiento hizo gran aporte a superar todos los desafios y dificultades de la historia, preservar la paz y la seguridad del mundo y defender los derechos e intereses colectivos de los paises miembros. 
					
					 El Presidente Kim Il Sung definio hace mucho tiempo la construccion de un nuevo mundo libre y pacifico como la mision principal del MNOAL y realizo incansables esfuerzos espirituales y fisicos por el desarrollo del movimiento y por el fortalecimiento de la solidaridad y cooperacion entre los paises miembros, recordo.
					
					 Desde que fue fundado, el MNOAL vino prestando siempre profunda atencion a la solucion del problema de la Peninsula Coreana y apoyando activamente los esfuerzos del gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC por la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de la patria y por la paz duradera de la Peninsula Coreana, apunto.
					
					 Dado que persisten las relaciones hostiles entre la RPDC y EE.UU. y entre ambas partes coreanas, la RPDC mantiene la posicion de aliviar la tension y crear la confianza mediante el dialogo y negociaciones y dirigirse a la reconciliacion, la cooperacion, la paz y la reunificacion, apunto y agrego que tales esfuerzos de la RPDC no recibieron la respuesta merecida. 
					
					 EE.UU. evade el dialogo poniendo diferentes condiciones y continua la amenaza nuclear, la sancion y la presion sobre la RPDC, critico.
					
					 Revelo que las actuales autoridades surcoreanas niegan obstinadamente la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y libran cada dia mas abiertamente las campanas conflictivas y belicistas contra la RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					 Responder al dialogo con el dialogo y a la sancion con la intransigencia, esto es la posicion del gobierno de la RPDC, enfatizo. 
					
					 Expreso profundo agradecimiento a los Paises No Alineados que apoyan la justa causa del pueblo coreano por preservar la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y lograr la reintegracion territorial del pais, y manifesto la esperanza y conviccion de que proseguira la solidaridad con la RPDC. 
					
					 Por ultimo, expuso la firme posicion de la RPDC de desarrollar el MNOAL para verificar la independencia en el mundo entero.
